line_text: As frowning at the favours of the world?
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Why are thine eyes fixed to the sullen earth,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Gazing on that which seems to dim thy sight?
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: What seest thou there? King Henry's diadem,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Enchased with all the honours of the world?
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: If so, gaze on, and grovel on thy face,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Until thy head be circled with the same.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Put forth thy hand, reach at the glorious gold.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: What, is't too short? I'll lengthen it with mine:
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And, having both together heaved it up,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: We'll both together lift our heads to heaven,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And never more abase our sight so low
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: As to vouchsafe one glance unto the ground.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: O Nell, sweet Nell, if thou dost love thy lord,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Banish the canker of ambitious thoughts.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And may that thought, when I imagine ill
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Against my king and nephew, virtuous Henry,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Be my last breathing in this mortal world!
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: My troublous dream this night doth make me sad.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: What dream'd my lord? tell me, and I'll requite it
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: With sweet rehearsal of my morning's dream.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Methought this staff, mine office-badge in court,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Was broke in twain; by whom I have forgot,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: But, as I think, it was by the cardinal;
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And on the pieces of the broken wand
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Were placed the heads of Edmund Duke of Somerset,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And William de la Pole, first duke of Suffolk.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: This was my dream: what it doth bode, God knows.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Tut, this was nothing but an argument
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: That he that breaks a stick of Gloucester's grove
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Shall lose his head for his presumption.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: But list to me, my Humphrey, my sweet duke:
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Methought I sat in seat of majesty
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: In the cathedral church of Westminster,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And in that chair where kings and queens are crown'd;
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Where Henry and dame Margaret kneel'd to me
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And on my head did set the diadem.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Nay, Eleanor, then must I chide outright:
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Presumptuous dame, ill-nurtured Eleanor,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Art thou not second woman in the realm,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And the protector's wife, beloved of him?
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Hast thou not worldly pleasure at command,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Above the reach or compass of thy thought?
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And wilt thou still be hammering treachery,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: To tumble down thy husband and thyself
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: From top of honour to disgrace's feet?
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Away from me, and let me hear no more!
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: What, what, my lord! are you so choleric
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: With Eleanor, for telling but her dream?
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Next time I'll keep my dreams unto myself,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And not be cheque'd.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Nay, be not angry; I am pleased again.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: My lord protector, 'tis his highness' pleasure
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: You do prepare to ride unto Saint Alban's,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Where as the king and queen do mean to hawk.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: I go. Come, Nell, thou wilt ride with us?
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Yes, my good lord, I'll follow presently.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Follow I must; I cannot go before,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: While Gloucester bears this base and humble mind.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Were I a man, a duke, and next of blood,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: I would remove these tedious stumbling-blocks
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And smooth my way upon their headless necks;
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And, being a woman, I will not be slack
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: To play my part in Fortune's pageant.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Where are you there? Sir John! nay, fear not, man,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: We are alone; here's none but thee and I.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Jesus preserve your royal majesty!
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: What say'st thou? majesty! I am but grace.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: But, by the grace of God, and Hume's advice,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Your grace's title shall be multiplied.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: What say'st thou, man? hast thou as yet conferr'd
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: With Margery Jourdain, the cunning witch,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: With Roger Bolingbroke, the conjurer?
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And will they undertake to do me good?
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: This they have promised, to show your highness
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: A spirit raised from depth of under-ground,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: That shall make answer to such questions
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: As by your grace shall be propounded him.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: It is enough; I'll think upon the questions:
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: When from St. Alban's we do make return,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: We'll see these things effected to the full.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Here, Hume, take this reward; make merry, man,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: With thy confederates in this weighty cause.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Hume must make merry with the duchess' gold;
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Marry, and shall. But how now, Sir John Hume!
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Seal up your lips, and give no words but mum:
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: The business asketh silent secrecy.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Dame Eleanor gives gold to bring the witch:
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Gold cannot come amiss, were she a devil.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Yet have I gold flies from another coast;
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: I dare not say, from the rich cardinal
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And from the great and new-made Duke of Suffolk,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Yet I do find it so; for to be plain,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: They, knowing Dame Eleanor's aspiring humour,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Have hired me to undermine the duchess
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And buz these conjurations in her brain.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: They say 'A crafty knave does need no broker;'
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Yet am I Suffolk and the cardinal's broker.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Hume, if you take not heed, you shall go near
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: To call them both a pair of crafty knaves.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Well, so it stands; and thus, I fear, at last
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Hume's knavery will be the duchess' wreck,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And her attainture will be Humphrey's fall:
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Sort how it will, I shall have gold for all.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: My masters, let's stand close: my lord protector
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: will come this way by and by, and then we may deliver
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: our supplications in the quill.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Marry, the Lord protect him, for he's a good man!
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Jesu bless him!
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Here a' comes, methinks, and the queen with him.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: I'll be the first, sure.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Come back, fool; this is the Duke of Suffolk, and
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: not my lord protector.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: How now, fellow! would'st anything with me?
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: I pray, my lord, pardon me; I took ye for my lord
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: protector.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: supplications to his lordship? Let me see them:
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: what is thine?
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Mine is, an't please your grace, against John
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Goodman, my lord cardinal's man, for keeping my
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: house, and lands, and wife and all, from me.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Thy wife, too! that's some wrong, indeed. What's
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: yours? What's here!
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: 'Against the Duke of Suffolk, for enclosing the
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: commons of Melford.' How now, sir knave!
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Alas, sir, I am but a poor petitioner of our whole township.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Horner, for saying that the Duke of York was rightful
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: heir to the crown.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: What sayst thou? did the Duke of York say he was
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: rightful heir to the crown?
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: That my master was? no, forsooth: my master said
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: that he was, and that the king was an usurper.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Who is there?
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Take this fellow in, and send for
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: his master with a pursuivant presently: we'll hear
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: more of your matter before the King.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And as for you, that love to be protected
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Under the wings of our protector's grace,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Begin your suits anew, and sue to him.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Away, base cullions! Suffolk, let them go.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Come, let's be gone.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: My Lord of Suffolk, say, is this the guise,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Is this the fashion in the court of England?
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Is this the government of Britain's isle,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And this the royalty of Albion's king?
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: What shall King Henry be a pupil still
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Under the surly Gloucester's governance?
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Am I a queen in title and in style,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And must be made a subject to a duke?
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: I tell thee, Pole, when in the city Tours
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Thou ran'st a tilt in honour of my love
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And stolest away the ladies' hearts of France,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: I thought King Henry had resembled thee
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: In courage, courtship and proportion:
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: But all his mind is bent to holiness,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: To number Ave-Maries on his beads;
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: His champions are the prophets and apostles,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: His weapons holy saws of sacred writ,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: His study is his tilt-yard, and his loves
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Are brazen images of canonized saints.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: I would the college of the cardinals
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Would choose him pope, and carry him to Rome,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And set the triple crown upon his head:
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: That were a state fit for his holiness.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Madam, be patient: as I was cause
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Your highness came to England, so will I
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: In England work your grace's full content.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Beside the haughty protector, have we Beaufort,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: The imperious churchman, Somerset, Buckingham,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And grumbling York: and not the least of these
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: But can do more in England than the king.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And he of these that can do most of all
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Cannot do more in England than the Nevils:
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Salisbury and Warwick are no simple peers.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Not all these lords do vex me half so much
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: As that proud dame, the lord protector's wife.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: She sweeps it through the court with troops of ladies,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: More like an empress than Duke Humphrey's wife:
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Strangers in court do take her for the queen:
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: She bears a duke's revenues on her back,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And in her heart she scorns our poverty:
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Shall I not live to be avenged on her?
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Contemptuous base-born callet as she is,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: She vaunted 'mongst her minions t'other day,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: The very train of her worst wearing gown
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Was better worth than all my father's lands,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Till Suffolk gave two dukedoms for his daughter.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Madam, myself have limed a bush for her,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And placed a quire of such enticing birds,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: That she will light to listen to the lays,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And never mount to trouble you again.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: So, let her rest: and, madam, list to me;
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: For I am bold to counsel you in this.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Although we fancy not the cardinal,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Yet must we join with him and with the lords,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Till we have brought Duke Humphrey in disgrace.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: As for the Duke of York, this late complaint
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Will make but little for his benefit.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: So, one by one, we'll weed them all at last,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And you yourself shall steer the happy helm.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: For my part, noble lords, I care not which;
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Or Somerset or York, all's one to me.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: If York have ill demean'd himself in France,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Then let him be denay'd the regentship.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: If Somerset be unworthy of the place,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Let York be regent; I will yield to him.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Whether your grace be worthy, yea or no,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Dispute not that: York is the worthier.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Ambitious Warwick, let thy betters speak.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: The cardinal's not my better in the field.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: All in this presence are thy betters, Warwick.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Warwick may live to be the best of all.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Peace, son! and show some reason, Buckingham,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Why Somerset should be preferred in this.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Because the king, forsooth, will have it so.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Madam, the king is old enough himself
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: To give his censure: these are no women's matters.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: If he be old enough, what needs your grace
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: To be protector of his excellence?
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Madam, I am protector of the realm;
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And, at his pleasure, will resign my place.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Resign it then and leave thine insolence.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Since thou wert king--as who is king but thou?--
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: The commonwealth hath daily run to wreck;
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: The Dauphin hath prevail'd beyond the seas;
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And all the peers and nobles of the realm
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Have been as bondmen to thy sovereignty.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: The commons hast thou rack'd; the clergy's bags
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Are lank and lean with thy extortions.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Thy sumptuous buildings and thy wife's attire
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Have cost a mass of public treasury.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Thy cruelty in execution
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Upon offenders, hath exceeded law,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And left thee to the mercy of the law.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: They sale of offices and towns in France,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: If they were known, as the suspect is great,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Would make thee quickly hop without thy head.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Give me my fan: what, minion! can ye not?
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: I cry you mercy, madam; was it you?
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Was't I! yea, I it was, proud Frenchwoman:
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Could I come near your beauty with my nails,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: I'd set my ten commandments in your face.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Sweet aunt, be quiet; 'twas against her will.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Against her will! good king, look to't in time;
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: She'll hamper thee, and dandle thee like a baby:
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Though in this place most master wear no breeches,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: She shall not strike Dame Eleanor unrevenged.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Lord cardinal, I will follow Eleanor,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And listen after Humphrey, how he proceeds:
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: She's tickled now; her fume needs no spurs,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: She'll gallop far enough to her destruction.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Now, lords, my choler being over-blown
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: With walking once about the quadrangle,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: I come to talk of commonwealth affairs.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: As for your spiteful false objections,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Prove them, and I lie open to the law:
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: But God in mercy so deal with my soul,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: As I in duty love my king and country!
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: But, to the matter that we have in hand:
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: I say, my sovereign, York is meetest man
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: To be your regent in the realm of France.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Before we make election, give me leave
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: To show some reason, of no little force,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: That York is most unmeet of any man.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: I'll tell thee, Suffolk, why I am unmeet:
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: First, for I cannot flatter thee in pride;
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Next, if I be appointed for the place,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: My Lord of Somerset will keep me here,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Without discharge, money, or furniture,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Till France be won into the Dauphin's hands:
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Last time, I danced attendance on his will
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Till Paris was besieged, famish'd, and lost.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: That can I witness; and a fouler fact
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Did never traitor in the land commit.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Peace, headstrong Warwick!
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Image of pride, why should I hold my peace?
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Because here is a man accused of treason:
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Pray God the Duke of York excuse himself!
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Doth any one accuse York for a traitor?
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: What mean'st thou, Suffolk; tell me, what are these?
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Please it your majesty, this is the man
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: That doth accuse his master of high treason:
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: His words were these: that Richard, Duke of York,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Was rightful heir unto the English crown
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And that your majesty was a usurper.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Say, man, were these thy words?
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: An't shall please your majesty, I never said nor
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: thought any such matter: God is my witness, I am
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: falsely accused by the villain.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: By these ten bones, my lords, he did speak them to
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: me in the garret one night, as we were scouring my
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Lord of York's armour.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Base dunghill villain and mechanical,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: I'll have thy head for this thy traitor's speech.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: I do beseech your royal majesty,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Let him have all the rigor of the law.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Alas, my lord, hang me, if ever I spake the words.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: My accuser is my 'prentice; and when I did correct
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: him for his fault the other day, he did vow upon his
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: knees he would be even with me: I have good
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: witness of this: therefore I beseech your majesty,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: do not cast away an honest man for a villain's
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: accusation.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Uncle, what shall we say to this in law?
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: This doom, my lord, if I may judge:
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Let Somerset be regent over the French,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Because in York this breeds suspicion:
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And let these have a day appointed them
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: For single combat in convenient place,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: For he hath witness of his servant's malice:
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: This is the law, and this Duke Humphrey's doom.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: I humbly thank your royal majesty.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And I accept the combat willingly.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Alas, my lord, I cannot fight; for God's sake, pity
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: my case. The spite of man prevaileth against me. O
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Lord, have mercy upon me! I shall never be able to
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: fight a blow. O Lord, my heart!
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Sirrah, or you must fight, or else be hang'd.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Away with them to prison; and the day of combat
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: shall be the last of the next month. Come,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Somerset, we'll see thee sent away.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Come, my masters; the duchess, I tell you, expects
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: performance of your promises.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Master Hume, that you be by her aloft, while we be
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: busy below; and so, I pray you, go, in God's name,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: and leave us.

line_text: Well said, my masters; and welcome all. To this
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: gear the sooner the better.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Patience, good lady; wizards know their times:

play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: The time when screech-owls cry and ban-dogs howl,

line_text: And spirits walk and ghosts break up their graves,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: That time best fits the work we have in hand.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Madam, sit you and fear not: whom we raise,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: We will make fast within a hallow'd verge.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Adsum.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Asmath,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: By the eternal God, whose name and power
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Thou tremblest at, answer that I shall ask;
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: For, till thou speak, thou shalt not pass from hence.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Ask what thou wilt. That I had said and done!

play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: In my opinion yet thou seest not well.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Yes, master, clear as day, I thank God and
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Saint Alban.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Say'st thou me so? What colour is this cloak of?
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Red, master; red as blood.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Why, that's well said. What colour is my gown of?
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Black, forsooth: coal-black as jet.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Why, then, thou know'st what colour jet is of?
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And yet, I think, jet did he never see.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: But cloaks and gowns, before this day, a many.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Never, before this day, in all his life.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Tell me, sirrah, what's my name?
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Alas, master, I know not.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: What's his name?
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: I know not.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Nor his?
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: No, indeed, master.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: What's thine own name?
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Saunder Simpcox, an if it please you, master.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Then, Saunder, sit there, the lyingest knave in
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Christendom. If thou hadst been born blind, thou
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: mightest as well have known all our names as thus to
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: name the several colours we do wear. Sight may
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: distinguish of colours, but suddenly to nominate them
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: all, it is impossible. My lords, Saint Alban here
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: hath done a miracle; and would ye not think his
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: cunning to be great, that could restore this cripple
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: to his legs again?
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: O master, that you could!
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: My masters of Saint Alban's, have you not beadles in
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: your town, and things called whips?
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Yes, my lord, if it please your grace.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Then send for one presently.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Sirrah, go fetch the beadle hither straight.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Now fetch me a stool hither by and by. Now, sirrah,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: if you mean to save yourself from whipping, leap me
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: over this stool and run away.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Alas, master, I am not able to stand alone:
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: You go about to torture me in vain.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Well, sir, we must have you find your legs. Sirrah
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: beadle, whip him till he leap over that same stool.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: I will, my lord. Come on, sirrah; off with your
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: doublet quickly.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Alas, master, what shall I do? I am not able to stand.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: O God, seest Thou this, and bearest so long?
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: It made me laugh to see the villain run.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Follow the knave; and take this drab away.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Alas, sir, we did it for pure need.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Let them be whipped through every market-town, till
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: they come to Berwick, from whence they came.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Duke Humphrey has done a miracle to-day.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: True; made the lame to leap and fly away.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: But you have done more miracles than I;
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: You made in a day, my lord, whole towns to fly.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: What tidings with our cousin Buckingham?
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Such as my heart doth tremble to unfold.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: A sort of naughty persons, lewdly bent,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Under the countenance and confederacy
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Of Lady Eleanor, the protector's wife,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: The ringleader and head of all this rout,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Have practised dangerously against your state,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Dealing with witches and with conjurers:
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Whom we have apprehended in the fact;
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Raising up wicked spirits from under ground,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Demanding of King Henry's life and death,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And other of your highness' privy-council;
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: As more at large your grace shall understand.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: by this means
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Your lady is forthcoming yet at London.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: This news, I think, hath turn'd your weapon's edge;
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: 'Tis like, my lord, you will not keep your hour.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Ambitious churchman, leave to afflict my heart:
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Sorrow and grief have vanquish'd all my powers;
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And, vanquish'd as I am, I yield to thee,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Or to the meanest groom.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: O God, what mischiefs work the wicked ones,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Heaping confusion on their own heads thereby!
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Gloucester, see here the tainture of thy nest.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And look thyself be faultless, thou wert best.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Madam, for myself, to heaven I do appeal,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: How I have loved my king and commonweal:
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And, for my wife, I know not how it stands;
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Sorry I am to hear what I have heard:
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Noble she is, but if she have forgot
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Honour and virtue and conversed with such
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: As, like to pitch, defile nobility,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: I banish her my bed and company
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And give her as a prey to law and shame,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: That hath dishonour'd Gloucester's honest name.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Well, for this night we will repose us here:
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: To-morrow toward London back again,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: To look into this business thoroughly
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And call these foul offenders to their answers
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And poise the cause in justice' equal scales,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Whose beam stands sure, whose rightful cause prevails.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Now, my good Lords of Salisbury and Warwick,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Our simple supper ended, give me leave
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: In this close walk to satisfy myself,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: In craving your opinion of my title,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Which is infallible, to England's crown.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: My lord, I long to hear it at full.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Sweet York, begin: and if thy claim be good,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: The Nevils are thy subjects to command.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Then thus:
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Edward the Third, my lords, had seven sons:
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: The first, Edward the Black Prince, Prince of Wales;
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: The second, William of Hatfield, and the third,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Lionel Duke of Clarence: next to whom
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Was John of Gaunt, the Duke of Lancaster;
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: The fifth was Edmund Langley, Duke of York;
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: The sixth was Thomas of Woodstock, Duke of Gloucester;
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: William of Windsor was the seventh and last.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Edward the Black Prince died before his father
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And left behind him Richard, his only son,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Who after Edward the Third's death reign'd as king;
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Till Henry Bolingbroke, Duke of Lancaster,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: The eldest son and heir of John of Gaunt,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Crown'd by the name of Henry the Fourth,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Seized on the realm, deposed the rightful king,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Sent his poor queen to France, from whence she came,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And him to Pomfret; where, as all you know,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Harmless Richard was murder'd traitorously.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Father, the duke hath told the truth:
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Thus got the house of Lancaster the crown.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Which now they hold by force and not by right;
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: For Richard, the first son's heir, being dead,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: The issue of the next son should have reign'd.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: But William of Hatfield died without an heir.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: The third son, Duke of Clarence, from whose line
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: I claimed the crown, had issue, Philippe, a daughter,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Who married Edmund Mortimer, Earl of March:
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Edmund had issue, Roger Earl of March;
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Roger had issue, Edmund, Anne and Eleanor.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: This Edmund, in the reign of Bolingbroke,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: As I have read, laid claim unto the crown;
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And, but for Owen Glendower, had been king,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Who kept him in captivity till he died.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: But to the rest.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: His eldest sister, Anne,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: My mother, being heir unto the crown
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Married Richard Earl of Cambridge; who was son
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: To Edmund Langley, Edward the Third's fifth son.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: By her I claim the kingdom: she was heir
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: To Roger Earl of March, who was the son
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Of Edmund Mortimer, who married Philippe,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Sole daughter unto Lionel Duke of Clarence:
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: So, if the issue of the elder son
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Succeed before the younger, I am king.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: What plain proceeding is more plain than this?
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Henry doth claim the crown from John of Gaunt,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: The fourth son; York claims it from the third.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Till Lionel's issue fails, his should not reign:
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: It fails not yet, but flourishes in thee
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And in thy sons, fair slips of such a stock.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Then, father Salisbury, kneel we together;
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And in this private plot be we the first
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: That shall salute our rightful sovereign
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: With honour of his birthright to the crown.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Long live our sovereign Richard, England's king!
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: We thank you, lords. But I am not your king
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Till I be crown'd and that my sword be stain'd
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: With heart-blood of the house of Lancaster;
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And that's not suddenly to be perform'd,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: But with advice and silent secrecy.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Do you as I do in these dangerous days:
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Wink at the Duke of Suffolk's insolence,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: At Beaufort's pride, at Somerset's ambition,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: At Buckingham and all the crew of them,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Till they have snared the shepherd of the flock,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: That virtuous prince, the good Duke Humphrey:
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: 'Tis that they seek, and they in seeking that
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Shall find their deaths, if York can prophesy.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: My lord, break we off; we know your mind at full.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: My heart assures me that the Earl of Warwick
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Shall one day make the Duke of York a king.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And, Nevil, this I do assure myself:
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Richard shall live to make the Earl of Warwick
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: The greatest man in England but the king.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Stand forth, Dame Eleanor Cobham, Gloucester's wife:
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  A hall of justice.

line_text: In sight of God and us, your guilt is great:
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  A hall of justice.

line_text: Receive the sentence of the law for sins
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  A hall of justice.

line_text: Such as by God's book are adjudged to death.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  A hall of justice.

line_text: You four, from hence to prison back again;
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  A hall of justice.

line_text: From thence unto the place of execution:
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  A hall of justice.

line_text: The witch in Smithfield shall be burn'd to ashes,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  A hall of justice.

line_text: And you three shall be strangled on the gallows.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  A hall of justice.

line_text: You, madam, for you are more nobly born,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  A hall of justice.

line_text: Despoiled of your honour in your life,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  A hall of justice.

line_text: Shall, after three days' open penance done,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  A hall of justice.

line_text: Live in your country here in banishment,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  A hall of justice.

line_text: With Sir John Stanley, in the Isle of Man.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  A hall of justice.

line_text: Welcome is banishment; welcome were my death.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  A hall of justice.

line_text: Eleanor, the law, thou see'st, hath judged thee:
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  A hall of justice.

line_text: I cannot justify whom the law condemns.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  A hall of justice.

line_text: Mine eyes are full of tears, my heart of grief.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  A hall of justice.

line_text: Ah, Humphrey, this dishonour in thine age
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  A hall of justice.

line_text: Will bring thy head with sorrow to the ground!
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  A hall of justice.

line_text: I beseech your majesty, give me leave to go;
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  A hall of justice.

line_text: Sorrow would solace and mine age would ease.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  A hall of justice.

line_text: Stay, Humphrey Duke of Gloucester: ere thou go,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  A hall of justice.

line_text: Give up thy staff: Henry will to himself
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  A hall of justice.

line_text: Protector be; and God shall be my hope,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  A hall of justice.

line_text: My stay, my guide and lantern to my feet:
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  A hall of justice.

line_text: And go in peace, Humphrey, no less beloved
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  A hall of justice.

line_text: Than when thou wert protector to thy King.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  A hall of justice.

line_text: I see no reason why a king of years
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  A hall of justice.

line_text: Should be to be protected like a child.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  A hall of justice.

line_text: God and King Henry govern England's realm.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  A hall of justice.

line_text: Give up your staff, sir, and the king his realm.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  A hall of justice.

line_text: My staff? here, noble Henry, is my staff:
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  A hall of justice.

line_text: As willingly do I the same resign
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  A hall of justice.

line_text: As e'er thy father Henry made it mine;
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  A hall of justice.

line_text: And even as willingly at thy feet I leave it
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  A hall of justice.

line_text: As others would ambitiously receive it.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  A hall of justice.

line_text: Farewell, good king: when I am dead and gone,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  A hall of justice.

line_text: May honourable peace attend thy throne!
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  A hall of justice.

line_text: Why, now is Henry king, and Margaret queen;
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  A hall of justice.

line_text: And Humphrey Duke of Gloucester scarce himself,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  A hall of justice.

line_text: That bears so shrewd a maim; two pulls at once;
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  A hall of justice.

line_text: His lady banish'd, and a limb lopp'd off.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  A hall of justice.

line_text: This staff of honour raught, there let it stand
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  A hall of justice.

line_text: Where it best fits to be, in Henry's hand.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  A hall of justice.

line_text: Thus droops this lofty pine and hangs his sprays;
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  A hall of justice.

line_text: Thus Eleanor's pride dies in her youngest days.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  A hall of justice.

line_text: Lords, let him go. Please it your majesty,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  A hall of justice.

line_text: This is the day appointed for the combat;
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  A hall of justice.

line_text: And ready are the appellant and defendant,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  A hall of justice.

line_text: The armourer and his man, to enter the lists,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  A hall of justice.

line_text: So please your highness to behold the fight.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  A hall of justice.

line_text: Ay, good my lord; for purposely therefore
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  A hall of justice.

line_text: Left I the court, to see this quarrel tried.

play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: a fig for Peter!

line_text: Here, Peter, I drink to thee: and be not afraid.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  A hall of justice.

play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: for credit of the 'prentices.

line_text: you; for I think I have taken my last draught in
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: this world. Here, Robin, an if I die, I give thee
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  A hall of justice.

line_text: my apron: and, Will, thou shalt have my hammer:
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: and here, Tom, take all the money that I have. O
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  A hall of justice.

line_text: Lord bless me! I pray God! for I am never able to
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  A hall of justice.

line_text: deal with my master, he hath learnt me so much fence already.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  A hall of justice.

line_text: Come, leave your drinking, and fall to blows.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  A hall of justice.

line_text: Sirrah, what's thy name?
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  A hall of justice.

line_text: Peter, forsooth.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  A hall of justice.

line_text: Peter! what more?
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  A hall of justice.

line_text: Thump.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  A hall of justice.

line_text: Thump! then see thou thump thy master well.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  A hall of justice.

line_text: Masters, I am come hither, as it were, upon my man's
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  A hall of justice.

line_text: instigation, to prove him a knave and myself an
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  A hall of justice.

line_text: honest man: and touching the Duke of York, I will
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  A hall of justice.

line_text: take my death, I never meant him any ill, nor the
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  A hall of justice.

line_text: king, nor the queen: and therefore, Peter, have at
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: thee with a downright blow!
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  A hall of justice.

line_text: Dispatch: this knave's tongue begins to double.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  A hall of justice.

line_text: Sound, trumpets, alarum to the combatants!
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  A hall of justice.

line_text: Hold, Peter, hold! I confess, I confess treason.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  A hall of justice.

line_text: Take away his weapon. Fellow, thank God, and the
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  A hall of justice.

line_text: good wine in thy master's way.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  A hall of justice.

line_text: O God, have I overcome mine enemy in this presence?
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  A hall of justice.

line_text: O Peter, thou hast prevailed in right!
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  A hall of justice.

line_text: Go, take hence that traitor from our sight;
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  A hall of justice.

line_text: For his death we do perceive his guilt:
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  A hall of justice.

line_text: And God in justice hath revealed to us
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  A hall of justice.

line_text: The truth and innocence of this poor fellow,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  A hall of justice.

line_text: Which he had thought to have murder'd wrongfully.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  A hall of justice.

line_text: Come, fellow, follow us for thy reward.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  A hall of justice.

line_text: Thus sometimes hath the brightest day a cloud;
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And after summer evermore succeeds
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Barren winter, with his wrathful nipping cold:
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: So cares and joys abound, as seasons fleet.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Sirs, what's o'clock?
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Ten, my lord.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Ten is the hour that was appointed me
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: To watch the coming of my punish'd duchess:
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Uneath may she endure the flinty streets,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: To tread them with her tender-feeling feet.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Sweet Nell, ill can thy noble mind abrook
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: The abject people gazing on thy face,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: With envious looks, laughing at thy shame,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: That erst did follow thy proud chariot-wheels
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: When thou didst ride in triumph through the streets.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: But, soft! I think she comes; and I'll prepare
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: My tear-stain'd eyes to see her miseries.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: So please your grace, we'll take her from the sheriff.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: No, stir not, for your lives; let her pass by.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Come you, my lord, to see my open shame?
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Now thou dost penance too. Look how they gaze!
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: See how the giddy multitude do point,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And nod their heads, and throw their eyes on thee!
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Ah, Gloucester, hide thee from their hateful looks,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And, in thy closet pent up, rue my shame,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And ban thine enemies, both mine and thine!
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Be patient, gentle Nell; forget this grief.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Ah, Gloucester, teach me to forget myself!
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: For whilst I think I am thy married wife
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And thou a prince, protector of this land,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Methinks I should not thus be led along,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Mail'd up in shame, with papers on my back,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And followed with a rabble that rejoice
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: To see my tears and hear my deep-fet groans.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: The ruthless flint doth cut my tender feet,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And when I start, the envious people laugh
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And bid me be advised how I tread.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Ah, Humphrey, can I bear this shameful yoke?
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Trow'st thou that e'er I'll look upon the world,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Or count them happy that enjoy the sun?
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: No; dark shall be my light and night my day;
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: To think upon my pomp shall be my hell.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Sometime I'll say, I am Duke Humphrey's wife,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And he a prince and ruler of the land:
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Yet so he ruled and such a prince he was
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: As he stood by whilst I, his forlorn duchess,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Was made a wonder and a pointing-stock
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: To every idle rascal follower.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: But be thou mild and blush not at my shame,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Nor stir at nothing till the axe of death
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Hang over thee, as, sure, it shortly will;
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: For Suffolk, he that can do all in all
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: With her that hateth thee and hates us all,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And York and impious Beaufort, that false priest,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Have all limed bushes to betray thy wings,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And, fly thou how thou canst, they'll tangle thee:
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: But fear not thou, until thy foot be snared,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Nor never seek prevention of thy foes.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Ah, Nell, forbear! thou aimest all awry;
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: I must offend before I be attainted;
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And had I twenty times so many foes,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And each of them had twenty times their power,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: All these could not procure me any scathe,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: So long as I am loyal, true and crimeless.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Wouldst have me rescue thee from this reproach?
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Why, yet thy scandal were not wiped away
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: But I in danger for the breach of law.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Thy greatest help is quiet, gentle Nell:
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: I pray thee, sort thy heart to patience;
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: These few days' wonder will be quickly worn.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: I summon your grace to his majesty's parliament,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Holden at Bury the first of this next month.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And my consent ne'er ask'd herein before!
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: This is close dealing. Well, I will be there.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: My Nell, I take my leave: and, master sheriff,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Let not her penance exceed the king's commission.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: An't please your grace, here my commission stays,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And Sir John Stanley is appointed now
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: To take her with him to the Isle of Man.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Must you, Sir John, protect my lady here?
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: So am I given in charge, may't please your grace.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Entreat her not the worse in that I pray
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: You use her well: the world may laugh again;
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And I may live to do you kindness if
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: You do it her: and so, Sir John, farewell!
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: What, gone, my lord, and bid me not farewell!
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Witness my tears, I cannot stay to speak.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Art thou gone too? all comfort go with thee!
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: For none abides with me: my joy is death;
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Death, at whose name I oft have been afear'd,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Because I wish'd this world's eternity.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Stanley, I prithee, go, and take me hence;
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: I care not whither, for I beg no favour,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Only convey me where thou art commanded.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Why, madam, that is to the Isle of Man;
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: There to be used according to your state.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: That's bad enough, for I am but reproach:
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And shall I then be used reproachfully?
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Like to a duchess, and Duke Humphrey's lady;
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: According to that state you shall be used.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Sheriff, farewell, and better than I fare,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Although thou hast been conduct of my shame.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: It is my office; and, madam, pardon me.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Ay, ay, farewell; thy office is discharged.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Come, Stanley, shall we go?
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Madam, your penance done, throw off this sheet,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And go we to attire you for our journey.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: My shame will not be shifted with my sheet:
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: No, it will hang upon my richest robes
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And show itself, attire me how I can.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Go, lead the way; I long to see my prison.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: I muse my Lord of Gloucester is not come:
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: 'Tis not his wont to be the hindmost man,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: Whate'er occasion keeps him from us now.
