play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: Can you not see? or will ye not observe
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: The strangeness of his alter'd countenance?
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: With what a majesty he bears himself,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: How insolent of late he is become,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: How proud, how peremptory, and unlike himself?
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: We know the time since he was mild and affable,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: And if we did but glance a far-off look,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: Immediately he was upon his knee,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: That all the court admired him for submission:
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: But meet him now, and, be it in the morn,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: When every one will give the time of day,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: He knits his brow and shows an angry eye,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: And passeth by with stiff unbowed knee,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: Disdaining duty that to us belongs.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: Small curs are not regarded when they grin;
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: But great men tremble when the lion roars;
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: And Humphrey is no little man in England.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: First note that he is near you in descent,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: And should you fall, he as the next will mount.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: Me seemeth then it is no policy,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: Respecting what a rancorous mind he bears
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: And his advantage following your decease,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: That he should come about your royal person
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: Or be admitted to your highness' council.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: By flattery hath he won the commons' hearts,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: And when he please to make commotion,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: 'Tis to be fear'd they all will follow him.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: Now 'tis the spring, and weeds are shallow-rooted;
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: Suffer them now, and they'll o'ergrow the garden
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: And choke the herbs for want of husbandry.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: The reverent care I bear unto my lord
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: Made me collect these dangers in the duke.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: If it be fond, call it a woman's fear;
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: Which fear if better reasons can supplant,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: I will subscribe and say I wrong'd the duke.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: My Lord of Suffolk, Buckingham, and York,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: Reprove my allegation, if you can;
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: Or else conclude my words effectual.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: Well hath your highness seen into this duke;
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: And, had I first been put to speak my mind,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: I think I should have told your grace's tale.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: The duchess, by his subornation,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: Upon my life, began her devilish practises:
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: Or, if he were not privy to those faults,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: Yet, by reputing of his high descent,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: As next the king he was successive heir,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: And such high vaunts of his nobility,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: Did instigate the bedlam brain-sick duchess
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: By wicked means to frame our sovereign's fall.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: Smooth runs the water where the brook is deep;
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: And in his simple show he harbours treason.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: The fox barks not when he would steal the lamb.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: No, no, my sovereign; Gloucester is a man
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: Unsounded yet and full of deep deceit.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: Did he not, contrary to form of law,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: Devise strange deaths for small offences done?
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: And did he not, in his protectorship,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: Levy great sums of money through the realm
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: For soldiers' pay in France, and never sent it?
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: By means whereof the towns each day revolted.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: Tut, these are petty faults to faults unknown.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: Which time will bring to light in smooth
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: Duke Humphrey.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: My lords, at once: the care you have of us,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: To mow down thorns that would annoy our foot,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: Is worthy praise: but, shall I speak my conscience,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: Our kinsman Gloucester is as innocent
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: From meaning treason to our royal person
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: As is the sucking lamb or harmless dove:
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: The duke is virtuous, mild and too well given
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: To dream on evil or to work my downfall.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: Ah, what's more dangerous than this fond affiance!
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: Seems he a dove? his feathers are but borrowed,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: For he's disposed as the hateful raven:
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: Is he a lamb? his skin is surely lent him,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: For he's inclined as is the ravenous wolf.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: Who cannot steal a shape that means deceit?
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: Take heed, my lord; the welfare of us all
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: Hangs on the cutting short that fraudful man.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: All health unto my gracious sovereign!
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: Welcome, Lord Somerset. What news from France?
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: That all your interest in those territories
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: Is utterly bereft you; all is lost.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: Cold news, Lord Somerset: but God's will be done!
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: As firmly as I hope for fertile England.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: Thus are my blossoms blasted in the bud
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: And caterpillars eat my leaves away;
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: But I will remedy this gear ere long,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: Or sell my title for a glorious grave.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: All happiness unto my lord the king!
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: Pardon, my liege, that I have stay'd so long.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: Nay, Gloucester, know that thou art come too soon,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: Unless thou wert more loyal than thou art:
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: I do arrest thee of high treason here.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: Well, Suffolk, thou shalt not see me blush
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: Nor change my countenance for this arrest:
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: A heart unspotted is not easily daunted.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: The purest spring is not so free from mud
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: As I am clear from treason to my sovereign:
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: Who can accuse me? wherein am I guilty?
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: 'Tis thought, my lord, that you took bribes of France,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: And, being protector, stayed the soldiers' pay;
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: By means whereof his highness hath lost France.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: Is it but thought so? what are they that think it?
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: I never robb'd the soldiers of their pay,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: Nor ever had one penny bribe from France.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: So help me God, as I have watch'd the night,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: Ay, night by night, in studying good for England,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: That doit that e'er I wrested from the king,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: Or any groat I hoarded to my use,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: Be brought against me at my trial-day!
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: No; many a pound of mine own proper store,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: Because I would not tax the needy commons,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: Have I disbursed to the garrisons,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: And never ask'd for restitution.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: It serves you well, my lord, to say so much.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: I say no more than truth, so help me God!
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: In your protectorship you did devise
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: Strange tortures for offenders never heard of,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: That England was defamed by tyranny.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: Why, 'tis well known that, whiles I was
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: protector,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: Pity was all the fault that was in me;
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: For I should melt at an offender's tears,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: And lowly words were ransom for their fault.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: Unless it were a bloody murderer,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: Or foul felonious thief that fleeced poor passengers,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: I never gave them condign punishment:
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: Murder indeed, that bloody sin, I tortured
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: Above the felon or what trespass else.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: My lord, these faults are easy, quickly answered:
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: But mightier crimes are laid unto your charge,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: Whereof you cannot easily purge yourself.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: I do arrest you in his highness' name;
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: And here commit you to my lord cardinal
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: To keep, until your further time of trial.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: My lord of Gloucester, 'tis my special hope
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: That you will clear yourself from all suspect:
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: My conscience tells me you are innocent.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: Ah, gracious lord, these days are dangerous:
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: Virtue is choked with foul ambition
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: And charity chased hence by rancour's hand;
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: Foul subornation is predominant
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: And equity exiled your highness' land.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: I know their complot is to have my life,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: And if my death might make this island happy,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: And prove the period of their tyranny,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: I would expend it with all willingness:
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: But mine is made the prologue to their play;
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: For thousands more, that yet suspect no peril,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: Will not conclude their plotted tragedy.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: Beaufort's red sparkling eyes blab his heart's malice,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: And Suffolk's cloudy brow his stormy hate;
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: Sharp Buckingham unburthens with his tongue
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: The envious load that lies upon his heart;
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: And dogged York, that reaches at the moon,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: Whose overweening arm I have pluck'd back,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: By false accuse doth level at my life:
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: And you, my sovereign lady, with the rest,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: Causeless have laid disgraces on my head,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: And with your best endeavour have stirr'd up
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: My liefest liege to be mine enemy:
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: Ay, all you have laid your heads together--
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: Myself had notice of your conventicles--
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: And all to make away my guiltless life.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: I shall not want false witness to condemn me,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: Nor store of treasons to augment my guilt;
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: The ancient proverb will be well effected:
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: 'A staff is quickly found to beat a dog.'
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: My liege, his railing is intolerable:
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: If those that care to keep your royal person
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: From treason's secret knife and traitors' rage
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: Be thus upbraided, chid and rated at,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: And the offender granted scope of speech,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: 'Twill make them cool in zeal unto your grace.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: Hath he not twit our sovereign lady here
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: With ignominious words, though clerkly couch'd,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: As if she had suborned some to swear
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: False allegations to o'erthrow his state?
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: But I can give the loser leave to chide.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: Far truer spoke than meant: I lose, indeed;
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: Beshrew the winners, for they play'd me false!
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: And well such losers may have leave to speak.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: He'll wrest the sense and hold us here all day:
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: Lord cardinal, he is your prisoner.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: Sirs, take away the duke, and guard him sure.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: Ah! thus King Henry throws away his crutch
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: Before his legs be firm to bear his body.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: Thus is the shepherd beaten from thy side,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: And wolves are gnarling who shall gnaw thee first.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: Ah, that my fear were false! ah, that it were!
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: For, good King Henry, thy decay I fear.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: My lords, what to your wisdoms seemeth best,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: Do or undo, as if ourself were here.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: What, will your highness leave the parliament?
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: Ay, Margaret; my heart is drown'd with grief,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: Whose flood begins to flow within mine eyes,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: My body round engirt with misery,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: For what's more miserable than discontent?
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: Ah, uncle Humphrey! in thy face I see
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: The map of honour, truth and loyalty:
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: And yet, good Humphrey, is the hour to come
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: That e'er I proved thee false or fear'd thy faith.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: What louring star now envies thy estate,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: That these great lords and Margaret our queen
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: Do seek subversion of thy harmless life?
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: Thou never didst them wrong, nor no man wrong;
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: And as the butcher takes away the calf
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: And binds the wretch, and beats it when it strays,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: Bearing it to the bloody slaughter-house,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: Even so remorseless have they borne him hence;
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: And as the dam runs lowing up and down,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: Looking the way her harmless young one went,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: And can do nought but wail her darling's loss,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: Even so myself bewails good Gloucester's case
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: With sad unhelpful tears, and with dimm'd eyes
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: Look after him and cannot do him good,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: So mighty are his vowed enemies.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: His fortunes I will weep; and, 'twixt each groan
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: Say 'Who's a traitor? Gloucester he is none.'
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: Free lords, cold snow melts with the sun's hot beams.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: Henry my lord is cold in great affairs,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: Too full of foolish pity, and Gloucester's show
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: Beguiles him as the mournful crocodile
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: With sorrow snares relenting passengers,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: Or as the snake roll'd in a flowering bank,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: With shining chequer'd slough, doth sting a child
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: That for the beauty thinks it excellent.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: Believe me, lords, were none more wise than I--
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: And yet herein I judge mine own wit good--
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: This Gloucester should be quickly rid the world,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: To rid us of the fear we have of him.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: That he should die is worthy policy;
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: But yet we want a colour for his death:
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: 'Tis meet he be condemn'd by course of law.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: But, in my mind, that were no policy:
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: The king will labour still to save his life,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: The commons haply rise, to save his life;
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: And yet we have but trivial argument,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: More than mistrust, that shows him worthy death.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: So that, by this, you would not have him die.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: Ah, York, no man alive so fain as I!
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: 'Tis York that hath more reason for his death.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: But, my lord cardinal, and you, my Lord of Suffolk,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: Say as you think, and speak it from your souls,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: Were't not all one, an empty eagle were set
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: To guard the chicken from a hungry kite,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: As place Duke Humphrey for the king's protector?
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: So the poor chicken should be sure of death.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: Madam, 'tis true; and were't not madness, then,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: To make the fox surveyor of the fold?
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: Who being accused a crafty murderer,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: His guilt should be but idly posted over,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: Because his purpose is not executed.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: No; let him die, in that he is a fox,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: By nature proved an enemy to the flock,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: Before his chaps be stain'd with crimson blood,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: As Humphrey, proved by reasons, to my liege.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: And do not stand on quillets how to slay him:
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: Be it by gins, by snares, by subtlety,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: Sleeping or waking, 'tis no matter how,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: So he be dead; for that is good deceit
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: Which mates him first that first intends deceit.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: Thrice-noble Suffolk, 'tis resolutely spoke.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: Not resolute, except so much were done;
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: For things are often spoke and seldom meant:
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: But that my heart accordeth with my tongue,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: Seeing the deed is meritorious,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: And to preserve my sovereign from his foe,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: Say but the word, and I will be his priest.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: But I would have him dead, my Lord of Suffolk,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: Ere you can take due orders for a priest:
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: Say you consent and censure well the deed,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: And I'll provide his executioner,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: I tender so the safety of my liege.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: Here is my hand, the deed is worthy doing.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: And so say I.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: And I    and now we three have spoke it,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: It skills not greatly who impugns our doom.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: Great lords, from Ireland am I come amain,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: To signify that rebels there are up
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: And put the Englishmen unto the sword:
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: Send succors, lords, and stop the rage betime,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: Before the wound do grow uncurable;
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: For, being green, there is great hope of help.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: A breach that craves a quick expedient stop!
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: What counsel give you in this weighty cause?
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: That Somerset be sent as regent thither:
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: 'Tis meet that lucky ruler be employ'd;
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: Witness the fortune he hath had in France.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: If York, with all his far-fet policy,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: Had been the regent there instead of me,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: He never would have stay'd in France so long.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: No, not to lose it all, as thou hast done:
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: I rather would have lost my life betimes
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: Than bring a burthen of dishonour home
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: By staying there so long till all were lost.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: Show me one scar character'd on thy skin:
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: Men's flesh preserved so whole do seldom win.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: Nay, then, this spark will prove a raging fire,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: If wind and fuel be brought to feed it with:
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: No more, good York; sweet Somerset, be still:
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: Thy fortune, York, hadst thou been regent there,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: Might happily have proved far worse than his.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: What, worse than nought? nay, then, a shame take all!
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: And, in the number, thee that wishest shame!
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: My Lord of York, try what your fortune is.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: The uncivil kerns of Ireland are in arms
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: And temper clay with blood of Englishmen:
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: To Ireland will you lead a band of men,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: Collected choicely, from each county some,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: And try your hap against the Irishmen?
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: I will, my lord, so please his majesty.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: Why, our authority is his consent,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: And what we do establish he confirms:
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: Then, noble York, take thou this task in hand.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: I am content: provide me soldiers, lords,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: Whiles I take order for mine own affairs.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: A charge, Lord York, that I will see perform'd.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: But now return we to the false Duke Humphrey.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: No more of him; for I will deal with him
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: That henceforth he shall trouble us no more.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: And so break off; the day is almost spent:
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: Lord Suffolk, you and I must talk of that event.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: My Lord of Suffolk, within fourteen days
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: At Bristol I expect my soldiers;
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: For there I'll ship them all for Ireland.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: I'll see it truly done, my Lord of York.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: Now, York, or never, steel thy fearful thoughts,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: And change misdoubt to resolution:
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: Be that thou hopest to be, or what thou art
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: Resign to death; it is not worth the enjoying:
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: Let pale-faced fear keep with the mean-born man,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: And find no harbour in a royal heart.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: Faster than spring-time showers comes thought
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: on thought,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: And not a thought but thinks on dignity.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: My brain more busy than the labouring spider
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: Weaves tedious snares to trap mine enemies.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: Well, nobles, well, 'tis politicly done,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: To send me packing with an host of men:
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: I fear me you but warm the starved snake,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: Who, cherish'd in your breasts, will sting
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: your hearts.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: 'Twas men I lack'd and you will give them me:
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: I take it kindly; and yet be well assured
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: You put sharp weapons in a madman's hands.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: Whiles I in Ireland nourish a mighty band,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: I will stir up in England some black storm
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: Shall blow ten thousand souls to heaven or hell;
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: And this fell tempest shall not cease to rage
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: Until the golden circuit on my head,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: Like to the glorious sun's transparent beams,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: Do calm the fury of this mad-bred flaw.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: And, for a minister of my intent,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: I have seduced a headstrong Kentishman,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: John Cade of Ashford,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: To make commotion, as full well he can,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: Under the title of John Mortimer.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: In Ireland have I seen this stubborn Cade
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: Oppose himself against a troop of kerns,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: And fought so long, till that his thighs with darts
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: Were almost like a sharp-quill'd porpentine;
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: And, in the end being rescued, I have seen
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: Him caper upright like a wild Morisco,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: Shaking the bloody darts as he his bells.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: Full often, like a shag-hair'd crafty kern,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: Hath he conversed with the enemy,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: And undiscover'd come to me again
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: And given me notice of their villanies.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: This devil here shall be my substitute;
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: For that John Mortimer, which now is dead,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: In face, in gait, in speech, he doth resemble:
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: By this I shall perceive the commons' mind,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: How they affect the house and claim of York.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: Say he be taken, rack'd and tortured,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: I know no pain they can inflict upon him
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: Will make him say I moved him to those arms.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: Say that he thrive, as 'tis great like he will,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: Why, then from Ireland come I with my strength
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: And reap the harvest which that rascal sow'd;
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: For Humphrey being dead, as he shall be,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: And Henry put apart, the next for me.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  The Abbey at Bury St. Edmund's.

line_text: Run to my Lord of Suffolk; let him know
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.

line_text: We have dispatch'd the duke, as he commanded.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.

line_text: O that it were to do! What have we done?
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.

line_text: Didst ever hear a man so penitent?
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.

line_text: Here comes my lord.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.

line_text: Now, sirs, have you dispatch'd this thing?
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.

line_text: Ay, my good lord, he's dead.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.

line_text: Why, that's well said. Go, get you to my house;
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.

line_text: I will reward you for this venturous deed.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.

line_text: The king and all the peers are here at hand.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.

line_text: Have you laid fair the bed? Is all things well,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.

line_text: According as I gave directions?
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.

line_text: 'Tis, my good lord.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.

line_text: Away! be gone.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.

line_text: Go, call our uncle to our presence straight;
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.

line_text: Say we intend to try his grace to-day.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.

line_text: If he be guilty, as 'tis published.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.

line_text: I'll call him presently, my noble lord.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.

line_text: Lords, take your places; and, I pray you all,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.

line_text: Proceed no straiter 'gainst our uncle Gloucester
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.

line_text: Than from true evidence of good esteem
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.

line_text: He be approved in practise culpable.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.

line_text: God forbid any malice should prevail,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.

line_text: That faultless may condemn a nobleman!
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.

line_text: Pray God he may acquit him of suspicion!
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.

line_text: I thank thee, Meg; these words content me much.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.

line_text: How now! why look'st thou pale? why tremblest thou?
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.

line_text: Where is our uncle? what's the matter, Suffolk?
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.

line_text: Dead in his bed, my lord; Gloucester is dead.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.

line_text: Marry, God forfend!
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.

line_text: God's secret judgment: I did dream to-night
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.

line_text: The duke was dumb and could not speak a word.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.

line_text: How fares my lord? Help, lords! the king is dead.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.

line_text: Rear up his body; wring him by the nose.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.

line_text: Run, go, help, help! O Henry, ope thine eyes!
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.

line_text: He doth revive again: madam, be patient.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.

line_text: O heavenly God!
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.

line_text: How fares my gracious lord?
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.

line_text: Comfort, my sovereign! gracious Henry, comfort!
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.

line_text: What, doth my Lord of Suffolk comfort me?
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.

line_text: Came he right now to sing a raven's note,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.

line_text: Whose dismal tune bereft my vital powers;
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.

line_text: And thinks he that the chirping of a wren,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.

line_text: By crying comfort from a hollow breast,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.

line_text: Can chase away the first-conceived sound?
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.

line_text: Hide not thy poison with such sugar'd words;
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.

line_text: Lay not thy hands on me; forbear, I say;
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.

line_text: Their touch affrights me as a serpent's sting.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.

line_text: Thou baleful messenger, out of my sight!
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.

line_text: Upon thy eye-balls murderous tyranny
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.

line_text: Sits in grim majesty, to fright the world.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.

line_text: Look not upon me, for thine eyes are wounding:
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.

line_text: Yet do not go away: come, basilisk,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.

line_text: And kill the innocent gazer with thy sight;
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.

line_text: For in the shade of death I shall find joy;
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.

line_text: In life but double death, now Gloucester's dead.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.

line_text: Why do you rate my Lord of Suffolk thus?
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.

line_text: Although the duke was enemy to him,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.

line_text: Yet he most Christian-like laments his death:
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.

line_text: And for myself, foe as he was to me,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.

line_text: Might liquid tears or heart-offending groans
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.

line_text: Or blood-consuming sighs recall his life,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.

line_text: I would be blind with weeping, sick with groans,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.

line_text: Look pale as primrose with blood-drinking sighs,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.

line_text: And all to have the noble duke alive.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.

line_text: What know I how the world may deem of me?
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.

line_text: For it is known we were but hollow friends:
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.

line_text: It may be judged I made the duke away;
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.

line_text: So shall my name with slander's tongue be wounded,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.

line_text: And princes' courts be fill'd with my reproach.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.

line_text: This get I by his death: ay me, unhappy!
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.

line_text: To be a queen, and crown'd with infamy!
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.

line_text: Ah, woe is me for Gloucester, wretched man!
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.

line_text: Be woe for me, more wretched than he is.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.

line_text: What, dost thou turn away and hide thy face?
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.

line_text: I am no loathsome leper; look on me.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.

line_text: What! art thou, like the adder, waxen deaf?
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.

line_text: Be poisonous too and kill thy forlorn queen.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.

line_text: Is all thy comfort shut in Gloucester's tomb?
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.

line_text: Why, then, dame Margaret was ne'er thy joy.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.

line_text: Erect his statue and worship it,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.

line_text: And make my image but an alehouse sign.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.

line_text: Was I for this nigh wreck'd upon the sea
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.

line_text: And twice by awkward wind from England's bank
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.

line_text: Drove back again unto my native clime?
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.

line_text: What boded this, but well forewarning wind
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.

line_text: Did seem to say 'Seek not a scorpion's nest,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.

line_text: Nor set no footing on this unkind shore'?
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.

line_text: What did I then, but cursed the gentle gusts
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.

line_text: And he that loosed them forth their brazen caves:
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.

line_text: And bid them blow towards England's blessed shore,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.

line_text: Or turn our stern upon a dreadful rock
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.

line_text: Yet AEolus would not be a murderer,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.

line_text: But left that hateful office unto thee:
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.

line_text: The pretty-vaulting sea refused to drown me,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.

line_text: Knowing that thou wouldst have me drown'd on shore,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.

line_text: With tears as salt as sea, through thy unkindness:
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.

line_text: The splitting rocks cower'd in the sinking sands
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.

line_text: And would not dash me with their ragged sides,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.

line_text: Because thy flinty heart, more hard than they,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.

line_text: Might in thy palace perish Margaret.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.

line_text: As far as I could ken thy chalky cliffs,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.

line_text: When from thy shore the tempest beat us back,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.

line_text: I stood upon the hatches in the storm,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.

line_text: And when the dusky sky began to rob
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.

line_text: My earnest-gaping sight of thy land's view,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.

line_text: I took a costly jewel from my neck,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.

line_text: A heart it was, bound in with diamonds,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  Bury St. Edmund's. A room of state.

line_text: And threw it towards thy land: the sea received it,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
