line_text: But now is Cade driven back, his men dispersed;
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And now is York in arms to second him.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: I pray thee, Buckingham, go and meet him,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And ask him what's the reason of these arms.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Tell him I'll send Duke Edmund to the Tower;
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And, Somerset, we'll commit thee thither,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Until his army be dismiss'd from him.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: My lord,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: I'll yield myself to prison willingly,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Or unto death, to do my country good.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: In any case, be not too rough in terms;
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: For he is fierce and cannot brook hard language.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: I will, my lord; and doubt not so to deal
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: As all things shall redound unto your good.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Come, wife, let's in, and learn to govern better;
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: For yet may England curse my wretched reign.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Fie on ambition! fie on myself, that have a sword,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: and yet am ready to famish! These five days have I
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: hid me in these woods and durst not peep out, for
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: all the country is laid for me; but now am I so
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: hungry that if I might have a lease of my life for a
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: thousand years I could stay no longer. Wherefore,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: on a brick wall have I climbed into this garden, to
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: see if I can eat grass, or pick a sallet another
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: while, which is not amiss to cool a man's stomach
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: this hot weather. And I think this word 'sallet'
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: was born to do me good: for many a time, but for a
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: sallet, my brainpan had been cleft with a brown
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: bill; and many a time, when I have been dry and
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: bravely marching, it hath served me instead of a
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: quart pot to drink in; and now the word 'sallet'
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: must serve me to feed on.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Lord, who would live turmoiled in the court,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And may enjoy such quiet walks as these?
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: This small inheritance my father left me
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Contenteth me, and worth a monarchy.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: I seek not to wax great by others' waning,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Or gather wealth, I care not, with what envy:
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Sufficeth that I have maintains my state
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And sends the poor well pleased from my gate.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Here's the lord of the soil come to seize me for a
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: stray, for entering his fee-simple without leave.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Ah, villain, thou wilt betray me, and get a thousand
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: crowns of the king carrying my head to him: but
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: I'll make thee eat iron like an ostrich, and swallow
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: my sword like a great pin, ere thou and I part.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Why, rude companion, whatsoe'er thou be,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: I know thee not; why, then, should I betray thee?
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Is't not enough to break into my garden,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And, like a thief, to come to rob my grounds,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Climbing my walls in spite of me the owner,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: But thou wilt brave me with these saucy terms?
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Brave thee! ay, by the best blood that ever was
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: broached, and beard thee too. Look on me well: I
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: have eat no meat these five days; yet, come thou and
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: thy five men, and if I do not leave you all as dead
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: as a doornail, I pray God I may never eat grass more.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Nay, it shall ne'er be said, while England stands,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: That Alexander Iden, an esquire of Kent,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Took odds to combat a poor famish'd man.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Oppose thy steadfast-gazing eyes to mine,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: See if thou canst outface me with thy looks:
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Set limb to limb, and thou art far the lesser;
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Thy hand is but a finger to my fist,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Thy leg a stick compared with this truncheon;
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: My foot shall fight with all the strength thou hast;
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And if mine arm be heaved in the air,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Thy grave is digg'd already in the earth.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: As for words, whose greatness answers words,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Let this my sword report what speech forbears.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: By my valour, the most complete champion that ever I
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: heard! Steel, if thou turn the edge, or cut not out
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: the burly-boned clown in chines of beef ere thou
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: sleep in thy sheath, I beseech God on my knees thou
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: mayst be turned to hobnails.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: O, I am slain! famine and no other hath slain me:
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: let ten thousand devils come against me, and give me
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: but the ten meals I have lost, and I'll defy them
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: all. Wither, garden; and be henceforth a
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: burying-place to all that do dwell in this house,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: because the unconquered soul of Cade is fled.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Is't Cade that I have slain, that monstrous traitor?
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Sword, I will hollow thee for this thy deed,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And hang thee o'er my tomb when I am dead:
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Ne'er shall this blood be wiped from thy point;
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: But thou shalt wear it as a herald's coat,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: To emblaze the honour that thy master got.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Iden, farewell, and be proud of thy victory. Tell
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Kent from me, she hath lost her best man, and exhort
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: all the world to be cowards; for I, that never
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: feared any, am vanquished by famine, not by valour.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: How much thou wrong'st me, heaven be my judge.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Die, damned wretch, the curse of her that bare thee;
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And as I thrust thy body in with my sword,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: So wish I, I might thrust thy soul to hell.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Hence will I drag thee headlong by the heels
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Unto a dunghill which shall be thy grave,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And there cut off thy most ungracious head;
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Which I will bear in triumph to the king,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Leaving thy trunk for crows to feed upon.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: From Ireland thus comes York to claim his right,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: And pluck the crown from feeble Henry's head:
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: Ring, bells, aloud; burn, bonfires, clear and bright,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: To entertain great England's lawful king.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: Ah! sancta majestas, who would not buy thee dear?
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: Let them obey that know not how to rule;
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: This hand was made to handle naught but gold.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: I cannot give due action to my words,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: Except a sword or sceptre balance it:
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: A sceptre shall it have, have I a soul,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: On which I'll toss the flower-de-luce of France.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: Whom have we here? Buckingham, to disturb me?
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: The king hath sent him, sure: I must dissemble.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: York, if thou meanest well, I greet thee well.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: Humphrey of Buckingham, I accept thy greeting.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: Art thou a messenger, or come of pleasure?
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: A messenger from Henry, our dread liege,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: To know the reason of these arms in peace;
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: Or why thou, being a subject as I am,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: Against thy oath and true allegiance sworn,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: Should raise so great a power without his leave,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: Or dare to bring thy force so near the court.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: O, I could hew up rocks and fight with flint,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: I am so angry at these abject terms;
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: And now, like Ajax Telamonius,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: On sheep or oxen could I spend my fury.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: I am far better born than is the king,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: More like a king, more kingly in my thoughts:
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: But I must make fair weather yet a while,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: Till Henry be more weak and I more strong,--
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: Buckingham, I prithee, pardon me,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: That I have given no answer all this while;
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: My mind was troubled with deep melancholy.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: The cause why I have brought this army hither
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: Is to remove proud Somerset from the king,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: Seditious to his grace and to the state.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: That is too much presumption on thy part:
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: But if thy arms be to no other end,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: The king hath yielded unto thy demand:
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: The Duke of Somerset is in the Tower.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: Upon thine honour, is he prisoner?
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: Upon mine honour, he is prisoner.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: Then, Buckingham, I do dismiss my powers.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: Soldiers, I thank you all; disperse yourselves;
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: Meet me to-morrow in St. George's field,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: You shall have pay and every thing you wish.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: And let my sovereign, virtuous Henry,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: Command my eldest son, nay, all my sons,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: As pledges of my fealty and love;
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: I'll send them all as willing as I live:
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: Lands, goods, horse, armour, any thing I have,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: Is his to use, so Somerset may die.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: York, I commend this kind submission:
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: We twain will go into his highness' tent.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: Buckingham, doth York intend no harm to us,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: That thus he marcheth with thee arm in arm?
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: In all submission and humility
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: York doth present himself unto your highness.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: Then what intends these forces thou dost bring?
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: To heave the traitor Somerset from hence,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: And fight against that monstrous rebel Cade,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: Who since I heard to be discomfited.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: If one so rude and of so mean condition
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: May pass into the presence of a king,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: Lo, I present your grace a traitor's head,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: The head of Cade, whom I in combat slew.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: The head of Cade! Great God, how just art Thou!
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: O, let me view his visage, being dead,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: That living wrought me such exceeding trouble.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: Tell me, my friend, art thou the man that slew him?
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: I was, an't like your majesty.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: How art thou call'd? and what is thy degree?
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: Alexander Iden, that's my name;
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: A poor esquire of Kent, that loves his king.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: So please it you, my lord, 'twere not amiss
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: He were created knight for his good service.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: Iden, kneel down.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: Rise up a knight.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: We give thee for reward a thousand marks,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: And will that thou henceforth attend on us.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: May Iden live to merit such a bounty.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: And never live but true unto his liege!
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: See, Buckingham, Somerset comes with the queen:
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: Go, bid her hide him quickly from the duke.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: For thousand Yorks he shall not hide his head,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: But boldly stand and front him to his face.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: How now! is Somerset at liberty?
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: Then, York, unloose thy long-imprison'd thoughts,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: And let thy tongue be equal with thy heart.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: Shall I endure the sight of Somerset?
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: False king! why hast thou broken faith with me,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: Knowing how hardly I can brook abuse?
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: King did I call thee? no, thou art not king,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: Not fit to govern and rule multitudes,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: Which darest not, no, nor canst not rule a traitor.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: That head of thine doth not become a crown;
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: Thy hand is made to grasp a palmer's staff,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: And not to grace an awful princely sceptre.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: That gold must round engirt these brows of mine,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: Whose smile and frown, like to Achilles' spear,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: Is able with the change to kill and cure.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: Here is a hand to hold a sceptre up
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: And with the same to act controlling laws.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: Give place: by heaven, thou shalt rule no more
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: O'er him whom heaven created for thy ruler.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: O monstrous traitor! I arrest thee, York,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: Of capital treason 'gainst the king and crown;
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: Obey, audacious traitor; kneel for grace.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: Wouldst have me kneel? first let me ask of these,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: If they can brook I bow a knee to man.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: Sirrah, call in my sons to be my bail;
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: I know, ere they will have me go to ward,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: They'll pawn their swords for my enfranchisement.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: Call hither Clifford! bid him come amain,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: To say if that the bastard boys of York
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: Shall be the surety for their traitor father.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: O blood-besotted Neapolitan,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: Outcast of Naples, England's bloody scourge!
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: The sons of York, thy betters in their birth,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: Shall be their father's bail; and bane to those
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: That for my surety will refuse the boys!
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: See where they come: I'll warrant they'll
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: make it good.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: And here comes Clifford to deny their bail.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: Health and all happiness to my lord the king!
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: I thank thee, Clifford: say, what news with thee?
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: Nay, do not fright us with an angry look;
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: We are thy sovereign, Clifford, kneel again;
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: For thy mistaking so, we pardon thee.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: This is my king, York, I do not mistake;
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: But thou mistakest me much to think I do:
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: To Bedlam with him! is the man grown mad?
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: Ay, Clifford; a bedlam and ambitious humour
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: Makes him oppose himself against his king.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: He is a traitor; let him to the Tower,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: And chop away that factious pate of his.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: He is arrested, but will not obey;
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: His sons, he says, shall give their words for him.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: Will you not, sons?
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: Ay, noble father, if our words will serve.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: And if words will not, then our weapons shall.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: Why, what a brood of traitors have we here!
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: Look in a glass, and call thy image so:
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: I am thy king, and thou a false-heart traitor.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: Call hither to the stake my two brave bears,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: That with the very shaking of their chains
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: They may astonish these fell-lurking curs:
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: Bid Salisbury and Warwick come to me.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: Are these thy bears? we'll bait thy bears to death.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: And manacle the bear-ward in their chains,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: If thou darest bring them to the baiting place.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: Oft have I seen a hot o'erweening cur
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: Run back and bite, because he was withheld;
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: Who, being suffer'd with the bear's fell paw,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: Hath clapp'd his tail between his legs and cried:
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: And such a piece of service will you do,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: If you oppose yourselves to match Lord Warwick.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: Hence, heap of wrath, foul indigested lump,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: As crooked in thy manners as thy shape!
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: Nay, we shall heat you thoroughly anon.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: Take heed, lest by your heat you burn yourselves.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: Why, Warwick, hath thy knee forgot to bow?
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: Old Salisbury, shame to thy silver hair,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: Thou mad misleader of thy brain-sick son!
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: What, wilt thou on thy death-bed play the ruffian,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: And seek for sorrow with thy spectacles?
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: O, where is faith? O, where is loyalty?
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: If it be banish'd from the frosty head,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: Where shall it find a harbour in the earth?
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: Wilt thou go dig a grave to find out war,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: And shame thine honourable age with blood?
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: Why art thou old, and want'st experience?
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: Or wherefore dost abuse it, if thou hast it?
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: For shame! in duty bend thy knee to me
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: That bows unto the grave with mickle age.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: My lord, I have consider'd with myself
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: The title of this most renowned duke;
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: And in my conscience do repute his grace
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: The rightful heir to England's royal seat.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: Hast thou not sworn allegiance unto me?
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: I have.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: Canst thou dispense with heaven for such an oath?
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: It is great sin to swear unto a sin,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: But greater sin to keep a sinful oath.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: Who can be bound by any solemn vow
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: To do a murderous deed, to rob a man,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: To force a spotless virgin's chastity,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: To reave the orphan of his patrimony,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: To wring the widow from her custom'd right,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: And have no other reason for this wrong
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: But that he was bound by a solemn oath?
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: A subtle traitor needs no sophister.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: Call Buckingham, and bid him arm himself.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: Call Buckingham, and all the friends thou hast,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: I am resolved for death or dignity.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: The first I warrant thee, if dreams prove true.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: You were best to go to bed and dream again,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: To keep thee from the tempest of the field.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: I am resolved to bear a greater storm
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: Than any thou canst conjure up to-day;
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: And that I'll write upon thy burgonet,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: Might I but know thee by thy household badge.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: Now, by my father's badge, old Nevil's crest,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: The rampant bear chain'd to the ragged staff,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: This day I'll wear aloft my burgonet,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: As on a mountain top the cedar shows
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: That keeps his leaves in spite of any storm,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: Even to affright thee with the view thereof.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: And from thy burgonet I'll rend thy bear
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: And tread it under foot with all contempt,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: Despite the bear-ward that protects the bear.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: And so to arms, victorious father,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: To quell the rebels and their complices.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: Fie! charity, for shame! speak not in spite,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: For you shall sup with Jesu Christ to-night.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: Foul stigmatic, that's more than thou canst tell.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: If not in heaven, you'll surely sup in hell.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  Fields between Dartford and Blackheath.

line_text: Clifford of Cumberland, 'tis Warwick calls:
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And if thou dost not hide thee from the bear,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Now, when the angry trumpet sounds alarum
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And dead men's cries do fill the empty air,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Clifford, I say, come forth and fight with me:
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Proud northern lord, Clifford of Cumberland,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Warwick is hoarse with calling thee to arms.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: How now, my noble lord? what, all afoot?
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: The deadly-handed Clifford slew my steed,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: But match to match I have encounter'd him
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And made a prey for carrion kites and crows
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Even of the bonny beast he loved so well.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Of one or both of us the time is come.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Hold, Warwick, seek thee out some other chase,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: For I myself must hunt this deer to death.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Then, nobly, York; 'tis for a crown thou fight'st.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: As I intend, Clifford, to thrive to-day,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: It grieves my soul to leave thee unassail'd.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: What seest thou in me, York? why dost thou pause?
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: With thy brave bearing should I be in love,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: But that thou art so fast mine enemy.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Nor should thy prowess want praise and esteem,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: But that 'tis shown ignobly and in treason.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: So let it help me now against thy sword
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: As I in justice and true right express it.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: My soul and body on the action both!
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: A dreadful lay! Address thee instantly.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: La fin couronne les oeuvres.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Thus war hath given thee peace, for thou art still.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Peace with his soul, heaven, if it be thy will!
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Shame and confusion! all is on the rout;
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Fear frames disorder, and disorder wounds
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Where it should guard. O war, thou son of hell,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Whom angry heavens do make their minister
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Throw in the frozen bosoms of our part
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Hot coals of vengeance! Let no soldier fly.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: He that is truly dedicate to war
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Hath no self-love, nor he that loves himself
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Hath not essentially but by circumstance
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: The name of valour.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: O, let the vile world end,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And the premised flames of the last day
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Knit earth and heaven together!
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Now let the general trumpet blow his blast,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Particularities and petty sounds
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: To cease! Wast thou ordain'd, dear father,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: To lose thy youth in peace, and to achieve
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: The silver livery of advised age,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And, in thy reverence and thy chair-days, thus
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: To die in ruffian battle? Even at this sight
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: My heart is turn'd to stone: and while 'tis mine,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: It shall be stony. York not our old men spares;
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: No more will I their babes: tears virginal
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Shall be to me even as the dew to fire,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And beauty that the tyrant oft reclaims
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Shall to my flaming wrath be oil and flax.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Henceforth I will not have to do with pity:
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Meet I an infant of the house of York,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Into as many gobbets will I cut it
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: As wild Medea young Absyrtus did:
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: In cruelty will I seek out my fame.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Come, thou new ruin of old Clifford's house:
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: As did AEneas old Anchises bear,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: So bear I thee upon my manly shoulders;
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: But then AEneas bare a living load,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Nothing so heavy as these woes of mine.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: So, lie thou there;
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: For underneath an alehouse' paltry sign,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: The Castle in Saint Alban's, Somerset
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Hath made the wizard famous in his death.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Sword, hold thy temper; heart, be wrathful still:
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Priests pray for enemies, but princes kill.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Away, my lord! you are slow; for shame, away!
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Can we outrun the heavens? good Margaret, stay.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: What are you made of? you'll nor fight nor fly:
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Now is it manhood, wisdom and defence,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: To give the enemy way, and to secure us
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: By what we can, which can no more but fly.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: If you be ta'en, we then should see the bottom
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Of all our fortunes: but if we haply scape,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: As well we may, if not through your neglect,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: We shall to London get, where you are loved
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And where this breach now in our fortunes made
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: May readily be stopp'd.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: But that my heart's on future mischief set,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: I would speak blasphemy ere bid you fly:
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: But fly you must; uncurable discomfit
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Reigns in the hearts of all our present parts.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Away, for your relief! and we will live
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: To see their day and them our fortune give:
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Away, my lord, away!
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Of Salisbury, who can report of him,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Fields near St. Alban's.

line_text: That winter lion, who in rage forgets
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Fields near St. Alban's.

line_text: Aged contusions and all brush of time,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Fields near St. Alban's.

line_text: And, like a gallant in the brow of youth,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Fields near St. Alban's.

line_text: Repairs him with occasion? This happy day
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Fields near St. Alban's.

line_text: Is not itself, nor have we won one foot,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Fields near St. Alban's.

line_text: If Salisbury be lost.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Fields near St. Alban's.

line_text: My noble father,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Fields near St. Alban's.

line_text: Three times to-day I holp him to his horse,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Fields near St. Alban's.

line_text: Three times bestrid him; thrice I led him off,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Fields near St. Alban's.

line_text: Persuaded him from any further act:
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Fields near St. Alban's.

line_text: But still, where danger was, still there I met him;
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Fields near St. Alban's.

line_text: And like rich hangings in a homely house,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Fields near St. Alban's.

line_text: So was his will in his old feeble body.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Fields near St. Alban's.

line_text: But, noble as he is, look where he comes.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Fields near St. Alban's.

line_text: Now, by my sword, well hast thou fought to-day;
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Fields near St. Alban's.

line_text: By the mass, so did we all. I thank you, Richard:
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Fields near St. Alban's.

line_text: God knows how long it is I have to live;
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Fields near St. Alban's.

line_text: And it hath pleased him that three times to-day
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Fields near St. Alban's.

line_text: You have defended me from imminent death.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Fields near St. Alban's.

line_text: Well, lords, we have not got that which we have:
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Fields near St. Alban's.

line_text: 'Tis not enough our foes are this time fled,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Fields near St. Alban's.

line_text: Being opposites of such repairing nature.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Fields near St. Alban's.

line_text: I know our safety is to follow them;
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Fields near St. Alban's.

line_text: For, as I hear, the king is fled to London,
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Fields near St. Alban's.

line_text: To call a present court of parliament.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Fields near St. Alban's.

line_text: Let us pursue him ere the writs go forth.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Fields near St. Alban's.

line_text: What says Lord Warwick? shall we after them?
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Fields near St. Alban's.

line_text: After them! nay, before them, if we can.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Fields near St. Alban's.

line_text: Now, by my faith, lords, 'twas a glorious day:
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Fields near St. Alban's.

line_text: Saint Alban's battle won by famous York
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Fields near St. Alban's.

line_text: Shall be eternized in all age to come.
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Fields near St. Alban's.

line_text: Sound drums and trumpets, and to London all:
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Fields near St. Alban's.

line_text: And more such days as these to us befall!
play_title_long: The Second Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Fields near St. Alban's.
